hotels.notes: Lovely classic hotel tucked away in a courtyard in the 16th arrondissement walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe. Felt more residential and less touristy but luxorious.

restaurants.notes: Classic parisian restaurant serving rich dishes like snails, foie gras, and tenderloin. Has a Michelin star but felt a bit touristy and the food was a little disappointing.

hotels.notes: Located in the Roma Norte neighborhood, the hotel wraps around a lush courtyard where the hotel has set-up their restaurant seating area. Comfortable and clean rooms, good service, and a good deal relative to most four seasons.

restaurants.notes: Incredible spot for lunch or dinner. Bustling at all times during the day. Amazing fresh fish that you put into tortillas to create tacos.
Located in the Condesa neighborhood. Fun atmosphere, nice interior, good wine and shareable dishes.

day.notes: Iconic market with tons of stalls selling textiles, trinkets, art, food, and more. In the Coyoacan neighborhood, a short walk away from the Frida Kahlo house. About a 35 minute uber from downtown in non-rush hour. Recommend making a morning of it.

restaurants.notes: Lovely french bistro in the west village. Highly recommend - salad maison (light, fresh, and perfectly dressed), scallops, gnocchi (best thing we had), saucisse puree (their go-to dish, sausage and mashed potatoes).
Great spot for takeout or to dine-in. One of the best Chinese spots in the city - get the general tso's chicken, fried rice, egg rolls, and dumplings.

day.notes: Walk along the west-side of manhattan through Meatpacking and Chelsea on a raised walkway with lush landscaping and great views of the city.

night.notes: In Noho, the bar below the restaurant is a great spot for dancing and drinks. Difficult to get in as a walk-up but possible if you reserve an "affordable" cocktail table for a group.
